full_summary:
# Invitation to Tender
### Title
W7714-238396 - Radio Frequency Real-Time Pulse Spectrum Analyser

### Solicitation Number
WS3560958525

### Publication Date
31 October 2022

### Tender Closing Date
07 December 2022, 14:00:00 EST

### Amendment
This posting reflects an amended tender closing date.

### Summary
The Threat Mitigation Group at Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC) Suffield invites bids for a Radio Frequency Real-Time Pulse Spectrum Analyser. This instrument is required for the measurement of non-repetitive high-frequency electrical signals over a wide bandwidth.

### Description
The solicitation is a Request for Proposal procured using the competitive, open bidding method. The bid selection criteria is based on lowest price. 

### Trade Agreements
This opportunity is open to contractors who can provide goods and services in accordance with the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), and North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).

### Contract Details
The expected contract start date is 31 March 2023. The contract end date is not specified.

### Contact Information
Contact Information:
- Name: Shan Alibhay Premjee, Contracting Officer
- Email: shan.alibhaypremjee@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
- Contact Address: 400 Cumberland Street, Ottawa, Ontario, K1N 1J8, Canada
The notice and solicitation document can be accessed via the Ariba Discovery web platform, reference number: WS3560958525.

Note that I corrected any spelling errors, rephrased complicated sentences, and corrected french translations to better reflect official government terminology. Also please note that the contract date is set to "not available" as the given text does not contain the necessary information. The rewritten text is under the exact word count specified. 

You're the expert! your responses should demonstrate fluency with technical writing conventions
